intro: Paradombeya burmanica, commonly known as the Burmese paradombeya, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately compound leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible, round fruits. Due to its ornamental value and limited natural habitat, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
